pullRequest.body:
This PR defines the absolute ideal norm of a fractional ideal `I : FractionalIdeal R⁰ K` where
`K` is a fraction field of `R` as a zero-preserving group homomorphism with values in `ℚ` and proves that it generalises the norm on (integral) ideals  (and some other classical result). 

Also in this PR:
- Add the directory `Mathlib/RingTheory/FractionalIdeal` and move the file `Mathlib/RingTheory/FractionalIdeal.lean` to `Mathlib/RingTheory/FractionalIdeal/Basic.lean`. The new results are in `Mathlib/RingTheory/FractionalIdeal/Norm.lean`
- Define the `numerator` and `denominator` of a fractional ideal. These are used to define the norm. Also define a linear equiv between a fractional ideal and its `numerator`.
- Several technical lemmas.


---

The file `FractionalIdeal.Basic` is getting huge, we should split it... but in another PR, thanks!

bors merge

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion absNorm I = (Ideal.absNorm I.num : ℚ) / |Algebra.norm ℤ (I.den : R)| := rfl ```

```suggestion
theorem map_equivMapOfInjective_symm_apply {f : F} (i : Injective f) (p : Submodule R M)
```

Although this change makes sense, the fact that the two results above: `equivMapOfInjective` and `coe_equivMapOfInjective_apply` have explicit `f` , make me feel that this one should too for consistency. Of course, the other option would be to make `f` implicit in all three results.
Maybe `den_mul_self_eq_num` is a better name, but this not very important.

Isn't `h_inj` automatic since you assume `NoZeroSMulDivisors R P`?

Similarly below.
Indeed, I just need to add a `Nontrivial` hypothesis instead.

```suggestion
`FractionalIdeal.absNorm I = Ideal.absNorm I.num / |Algebra.norm ℤ I.den|` where `I.num` is an
```

```suggestion
  /-- An element of `S` such that `I.den • I = I.num`, see `FractionalIdeal.num` and
```
Similarly below.

I know you didn't introduce this, but I really think we should have `Nontrivial R` (or maybe this is even automatic since it is a dedekind domain) instead of `Infinite R`: since it is free this is enough.

I don't think Lean is able to find `Infinite R` by itself, but you can add the instance if you don't want to remove `Infinite R` everywhere. Or maybe just add a TODO if this is too much work for one PR.

Yeah, the hypothesis `Infinite R` is used only at one place in `Ideal.absNorm` and should indeed be replaced by `Nontrivial R` and the result that `Module.Free S R` + `Infinite S` + `Nontrivial R` implies `Infinite R`. I'll open a PR with this change to merge before this one.
I am a bit confused by `IsDomain K`. Wasn't `K` the fraction field of `R`?

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: Generalize absNorm to fractional ideals
